page.title: 13WELSH LANGUAGE IN HOLYWELL
page.content: Despite proximity to English border Holywell retained its Welshness seen in place names:{Penymaes Rd, Dewi Ave, {Llwyn Aled, Heulfryn.}Resurgence of interest in Welsh speaking, following an earlier decline is evident in education.Two English medium Primaries renamed{Perth-y-Terfyn and Ysgol y {Fron,}with the Comprehensive High, are bi-lingual.{Gwenffrwdd}Primary is a Welsh medium school. These participate in activities of{'Yr Urdd'}(Welsh League of Youth) competing in Eistedd- fodau at local and national level.Its branch youth club,{'Yr Aelwyd}caters for teenagers. A Sunday school and two non-conformist chapels worship in Welsh. The Welsh society,{'Y Gymdeith- {as Gymraeg}fosters Welsh culture.{Tre- {ffynnon,}the Welsh name for Holywell means "town of the well" St Winefrides Well is known as{Ffynnon Gwenffrewi.
